name: Hot wax injector
description:
Wax injector 1-shot 6cc maximum. 60 pounds plus 6 P&P (UK)
The injector is a safely modified 11mm, ‘Hot-glue gun’ for 220v mains operation. The modifications have NOT involved ANY alteration of the electrical circuitry. 
The heating barrel has been bored parallel and fitted with a piston rod for manual wax injection. The nozzle is tapped M3 for an anti-dribble screw. The gun has been internally ‘potted’ for extra electrical insulation, in case an ‘over-charged’ operation forces hot wax inside the injector.
The injector is supplied with a thermometer which reaches right into the barrel to ensure consistent results.
The injector is supplied with a ‘loading funnel’ for pellets of pattern wax (recommended) or can be loaded with 11mm diameter by 65mm long ‘bullets’ of pattern wax which need to be cast or extruded by the user. These ‘bullets’ allow the maximum injection capacity of 6cc, but a load of 5cc of wax pellets is more convenient and gives ample volume for rings / charms / pendants etc.
Supplied with instructions and a 50cc sample of pattern wax pellets.

The user needs to provide: A vulcanized rubber or silicone mould and mould clamp (a cheap wood-vice works well as shown in the photo) and a 5cc measuring cup. The ‘holster’ to support the injector in the vertical position for loading and heating is made from a kiddies plastic beaker with a cutout in the bottom and Evostuck to a piece of plywood.

name: Lost Wax Casting Course - for 1 person
description:
A one day course is offered in Coventry to support their new MICROFOUNDRY system for casting custom jewellery items in Brass, Bronze, Silver or Gold. The course objectives are: 
- To be confident in setting up a MICROFOUNDRY and to use it SAFELY in your own home
- To provide a day of creative crafting for anyone with no previous experience in casting Bronze or Silver items from wax models.

BRIEF OVERVIEW OF THE COURSE
Explanation of lost wax investment casting, types of wax, ways of forming the original wax model, hot and cold Carving, Moulding by Gravity, Injection and Machining. Students will inject their wax into a vulcanized rubber mould.

Mounting your wax model for investing, properties of a good investing powder, problems due to excessive porosity in the solid investment.

Safe environment for working. Safety in handling furnaces. The need for gloves, glasses, tongs and thermometer. Melting out the bulk of the wax, Burning out the remaining wax residues, Measuring the temperature of the furnaces for handling and the temperature of the flask when ready for pouring.
Choosing suitable metals, melting temperatures, pouring temperatures, alloying of metals for fluidity, colour, strength.Temperature measurement by Thermocouple, Pyrometric cones, IR non-contacting thermometer

Melting the metal, need for flux, stirring, drossing, pouring. Students will use gravity casting.

Quenching, de-flasking, de-sprueing, final shaping and cleaning the cast silver charm.
Identifying any defects in terms of poor procedure.
Silver soldering as a means of fabricating small castings into larger works or for ‘repair’ of a partially lost / broken feature. ‘Hard’ soldering is carried out if the work requires it.

The course is run at Compucut, 15 Allesley Old Road, Coventry. CV5 8BU 
The training classroom has TWO full sets of Waxing / Casting equipment enabling a maximum of TWO students per course, to produce jewellery castings in Silver from injected wax models.
Note, the training workshop is on a FIRST floor level with NO wheelchair access.

Courses can be run on week days or weekends to suit mutual convenience. Once the date is ‘booked’ then a cheque is mailed to R BARTLETT at least ONE week prior to the course. The cost covers all materials including 8g of Sterling Silver for each cast charm.

a quick video overview http://youtu.be/aiYTnCfr7NQ

A booked course can be re-scheduled without penalty as long as 24 hours notice is given.

Normal timetable is 10.00am to approx 5.00pm It is not unreasonable for some students to require more time to complete their work, so plan for a flexible finish time if possible. 
Wear or bring ‘hobby / craft’ clothing including sensible shoes, if you have long hair bring a hairnet or means to tie it back. Bring a packed lunch, Tea / Coffee are freely available all day.
Car parking is on-site (in front of No15, CV5 8BU). 
If TRAVELLING BY TRAIN: Arriving at Coventry train station, 10-minutes by taxi to ‘THE FOUR PROVINCES’ public house on Allesley Old Road, Spon End. Compucut is next door but one. For visitors travelling by train, an alternative start time can be arranged if required.

For booking contact Richard Bartlett: Tel 02476 473851 (2pm to 7pm preferred)
For any additional information, including leaving your name / phone number if the above number went unanswered: email info@compucutters.com

name: Microfoundry Lost Wax Casting System
description:
New lost wax casting system developed to enable jewellers and model engineers to easily cast their designs in silver, gold, brass, bronze, and copper. The lost wax casting of precious metals dates back to Egyptian times but can be bulky, dirty, expensive, and time consuming, so putting a lot of folk off. The Microfoundry was developed to make lost wax casting as 'doable'  as possible. Requiring just 1M of bench space, and little prior knowledge, the microfoundry uses a domestic microwave oven as a heat source as they are readily available, affordable, and non intimidating, hey if you can cook a pie you can melt a crucible of silver with microfoundry. It really is fun, honest, pleasetake a look at the photos and video clips on our facebook page www.facebook.com/steedcraft

The Microfoundry system contains a metal melting furnace, a wax burnout furnace, sprue plate, investment flask, 2 crucibels, safety equipment, and enough materials (wax, investment powder, BR10 casting grain, flux etc) to do your first several melts, and full instructions.

We offer support by phone, email, or post, and as a new year offer if you would like to arrange to pick your microfoundry system up in Coventry we will be pleased to provide a days free course to make your first silver casting.
